pullRequest.body:
This is useful for algebraically encoding equality of indices.

From LeanCamCombi

  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/9535673323/job/26281680823)

```suggestion
lemma pow_card_sub_one {p : â„•} [Fact p.Prime] (a : ZMod p) :
    a ^ (p - 1) = if a â‰  0 then 1 else 0 := by
```
Whoops indeed. I am editing mathlib cache-less since [this](https://leanprover.zulipchat.com/#narrow/stream/287929-mathlib4/topic/cache.20misses.20aesop) happened
Why test on `a â‰  0` instead of `a = 0`? Does it make sense to use `Pi.mulSingle` here?

The point is that `if p then 1 else 0` is used in plenty of statements, eg `Finset.sum_boole`. I'm happy to add other versions later but this is precisely the one I need for now.

Here is my use case for reference: https://github.com/YaelDillies/LeanCamCombi/blob/master/LeanCamCombi/ErdosGinzburgZiv.lean

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat: `a ^ (p - 1) = if a â‰  0 then 1 else 0` in `ZMod p`
